title: Cultural Value Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of core values that define organizational cultures in The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each cultural value (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

tradition.description: Respect for established practices, continuity with the past, and preservation of heritage.

innovation.description: Emphasis on new ideas, approaches, and willingness to break from conventional methods.

loyalty.description: Steadfast allegiance to the organization, its leadership, and fellow members.

efficiency.description: Maximizing productivity while minimizing wasted resources, effort, or time.

hierarchy.description: Respect for rank, clear chain of command, and deference to authority.

equality.description: Belief in fair treatment, equal voice, and distributed power among members.

competition.description: Encouraging rivalry, individual achievement, and striving to outperform others.

collaboration.description: Prioritizing teamwork, mutual support, and collective accomplishment.

secrecy.description: Protecting information, operating discreetly, and maintaining confidentiality.

transparency.description: Open sharing of information, processes, and decision-making with members or the public.

discipline.description: Adherence to rules, self-control, and structured behavior.

creativity.description: Valuing imagination, original thinking, and artistic or intellectual expression.

honor.description: Maintaining reputation, keeping one's word, and adhering to a code of conduct.

profit.description: Focus on financial gain, return on investment, and material prosperity.

service.description: Dedication to helping others, fulfilling needs, and providing benefits to constituencies.

strength.description: Valuing power, resilience, and the capacity to overcome opposition or challenges.

knowledge.description: Pursuit of information, wisdom, expertise, and understanding.

harmony.description: Maintaining balance, peaceful relations, and avoiding unnecessary conflict.

individuality.description: Respecting personal freedom, unique expression, and autonomous choice.

collectivism.description: Prioritizing group interests, shared identity, and communal wellbeing.

adaptability.description: Valuing flexibility, responsiveness to change, and evolution over time.

purity.description: Concern with cleanliness, moral correctness, and avoiding contamination or corruption.

ambition.description: Encouraging aspiration, goal-setting, and the drive to achieve greater heights.

integrity.description: Maintaining moral principles, ethical standards, and consistent values even when challenging.

ruthlessness.description: Willingness to take any actions necessary to achieve goals without moral constraint.

compassion.description: Concern for the suffering of others and desire to alleviate hardship.

sacrifice.description: Willingness to surrender personal interests for a greater cause or collective good.

excellence.description: Pursuit of superior quality, exceptional performance, and mastery in all activities.

spirituality.description: Recognition of metaphysical dimensions, connection to higher powers, or transcendent purpose.

pragmatism.description: Focus on practical outcomes, realistic solutions, and what works rather than ideals.

opposingPairs.description: Values that commonly exist in tension with each other (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)
